pageContext.claim: “We're doing a lot on gun safety, and we're working with the NRA, and we're working -- you know, we tried to work with a Democrats, but frankly, they don't even want to meet.”
pageContext.analysis: This is false. Sen. Chris Murphy (D-Conn.), for example, has said he continues to engage the White House on gun control even amid an impeachment inquiry in Congress. Trump often says he's interested in stronger background checks for gun sales after there's a mass shooting, only to backtrack later on. It happened again most recently after the El Paso shooting massacre. Trump told the NRA he would not be pursuing background checks, after initially saying he would.
